xxl.core.cursors
Class Cursors

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.cursors.Cursors

public abstract class Cursors
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains various static methods for manipulating iterators. For example :

  • A user defined function can be applied to each element of an iterator, to a couple of elements of two iterators traversed synchronously or even to a set of elements of an array of iterators.
  • A condition can be checked for a whole iterator by invoking a given boolean function or predicate on it.
  • Useful methods are given to determine the first, the last or the n'th element of an iterator, its minima and maxima and to update or remove all elements of an iterator.
  • Some converters are given, i.e., the caller is able to convert an iterator to a list, a map, a collection or an array.

Example usage (1): 

     Cursor<Integer> cursor = new Enumerator(11);
     cursor.open();
     
     System.out.println("First element : " + Cursors.first(cursor));
     
     cursor.reset();
     System.out.println("Third element : " + Cursors.nth(cursor, 3));
 
     cursor.reset();
     System.out.println("Last element : " + Cursors.last(cursor));
 
     cursor.reset();
     System.out.println("Length : " + Cursors.count(cursor));
 
     cursor.close();
These examples demonstrate some useful static methods for navigation in a cursor.

Example usage (2): 

     Map.Entry<?, LinkedList<Integer>> entry = Cursors.maximize(
         cursor = new DiscreteRandomNumber(new JavaDiscreteRandomWrapper(100), 50),
         new Identity<Integer>()
     );
     System.out.println("Maximum value is : " + entry.getKey());
 
     System.out.print("Maxima : ");
     for (Integer next : entry.getValue())
         System.out.print(next + "; ");
     System.out.flush();
     
     cursor.close();
This example computes the maximum value of 50 randomly distributed integers of the interval [0, 100) using a mapping. Also an iterator containing all maxima is printed to the output.

Example usage (3): 

     Cursors.forEach(
         new Function<Integer, Integer>() {
             public Integer invoke(Integer object) {
                 Integer result = (int)Math.pow(object, 2);
                 System.out.println("Number : " + object + " ; Number^2 : " + result);
                 return result;
             }
         },
         cursor = new Enumerator(11)
     );
     cursor.close();
This example computes the square value for each element of the given enumerator with range 0,...,10.

Example usage (4): 

     System.out.println(
         "Is the number '13' contained in the discrete random numbers' cursor : " +
         Cursors.any(
             new Predicate<Integer>() {
                 public boolean invoke(Integer object) {
                     return object == 13;
                 }
             },
             cursor = new DiscreteRandomNumber(new JavaDiscreteRandomWrapper(1000), 200)
         )
     );
     cursor.close();
This example checks if a cursor of 200 randomly distributed integers with maximum value 999 contains the value 13 by evaluating a predictate on its elements. It returns true if the predicate is true for only one element of the input cursor.

See Also:
Iterator, Cursor, Function, Predicate, Collection, List, Map, Map.Entry, Comparator

Method Detail

forEach

public static <E,R> void forEach(Function<? super E,R> function,
                                 java.util.Iterator<? extends E>... iterators)
Invokes the higher-order function on each set of elements given by the input iterator array. The set contains one element per iterator and the function is only invoked while all iterators are not empty.

Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements returned by the given iterator.
R - the type of the elements returned by the given function.
Parameters:
function - the function to be invoked on each set of elements.
iterators - the iterators used to get a set of elements by taking one element per iterator.

Returns true if the boolean higher-order function returns true applied on each set of elements of the given input iterator array. The set contains one element per iterator and the function is only applied while all iterators are not empty.

Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements returned by the given iterator.
Parameters:
function - the function to be invoked on each set of elements.
iterators - the iterators used to get a set of elements by taking one element of each iterator.
Returns:
true if the function returns true for each set of elements of the given input iterator array, otherwise false.

minimize

public static <E,M> java.util.Map.Entry<M,java.util.LinkedList<E>> minimize(java.util.Iterator<? extends E> iterator,
                                                                            Function<? super E,? extends M> getFeature,
                                                                            java.util.Comparator<? super M> comparator)
Returns a Map.Entry object with the minimal value as its key and the list of objects with this minimal value in the same order as provided by the iterator as its value.

Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements returned by the iteration to be aggregated.
M - the type of the mapped elements generated by the specified mapping function.
Parameters:
iterator - the objects to be minimized.
getFeature - the function obtaining the value for each object used to compare.
comparator - the comparator that compares the values obtained by getFeature.
Returns:
a map entry with the minimal value as its key and the list of objects with this minimal value in the same order as provided by the iterator as its value.

comparator - the comparator that compares the objects.
Returns:
a map entry with the minimal value as its key and the list of objects with this minimal value in the same order as provided by the iterator as its value.

removeAll

public static void removeAll(java.util.Iterator<?> iterator)
Removes all elements of the given iterator.

Parameters:
iterator - the input iterator.

removeAll

public static <E> void removeAll(java.util.Iterator<E> iterator,
                                 Predicate<? super E> predicate)
Removes the elements of the given iterator for that the specified predicate returns true.

Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements returned by the given iterator.
Parameters:
iterator - the input iterator.
predicate - a predicate that decides whether an element is removed or not.

removeFirst

public static <E> boolean removeFirst(java.util.Iterator<E> iterator,
                                      Predicate<? super E> predicate)
Removes the first element of the given iterator for that the specified predicate returns true.

Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements returned by the given iterator.
Parameters:
iterator - the input iterator.
predicate - a predicate that decides whether an element is removed or not.
Returns:
true if and only if an element was removed.

                                 Function<E,? extends E> function)

Parameters:
cursor - the input cursor.
function - the unary function used to compute the object for the update operation.

toArray

public static java.lang.Object[] toArray(java.util.Iterator<? extends java.lang.Object> iterator)
Converts an iterator to an object array whose length is equal to the number of the iterator's elements.

Parameters:
iterator - the input iterator.
Returns:
an object array containing the iterator's elements.

toArray

public static java.lang.Object[] toArray(java.util.Iterator<?> iterator,
                                         java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Integer> indices)
Converts an iterator to an object array whose length is determined by the largest index. Stops as soon as one iterator is exhausted.

Parameters:
iterator - the input iterator.
indices - each index determines where to store the corresponding iterator element.
Returns:
an object array of the iterator's elements following the order defined by the iterator indices.

toArray

public static <E> E[] toArray(java.util.Iterator<? extends E> iterator,
                              E[] array,
                              java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Integer> indices)
Converts an iterator to an object array using the given one. The order is defined by the given indices iterator. Stops as soon as one iterator is exhausted. Throws an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException if the given array is not long enough.

Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements returned by the given iterator.
Parameters:
iterator - the input iterator.
array - the array into which the elements of the given iteration are to be stored.
indices - each index determines where to store the corresponding iterator element.
Returns:
the object array containing the iterator's elements following the order defined by the iterator indices.
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the given array is not long enough.

toArray

public static <E> E[] toArray(java.util.Iterator<? extends E> iterator,
                              E[] array)
Converts an iterator to an object array using the given one. Throws an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException if the number of the iterator's elements is larger than the length of the given array.

Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements returned by the given iterator.
Parameters:
iterator - the input iterator.
array - the array into which the elements of the given iteration are to be stored.
Returns:
the object array containing the iterator's elements.
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the given array is not long enough.

toFittingArray

public static <E> E[] toFittingArray(java.util.Iterator<? extends E> iterator,
                                     E[] array)
Converts an iterator to an object array whose length is equal to the number of the iterator's elements. When the iterator contains more elements than the array is able to store, a new array of the same component type is created.

Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements returned by the given iterator.
Parameters:
iterator - the input iterator.
array - the array into which the elements of the given iteration are to be stored.
Returns:
an object array containing the iterator's elements.

toFittingArray

public static <E> E[] toFittingArray(java.util.Iterator<? extends E> iterator,
                                     E[] array,
                                     java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Integer> indices)
Converts an iterator to an object array whose length is determined by the largest index. Stops as soon as one iterator is exhausted. When the iterator contains more elements than the array is able to store, a new array of the same component type is created.

Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements returned by the given iterator.
Parameters:
iterator - the input iterator.
array - the array into which the elements of the given iteration are to be stored.
indices - each index determines where to store the corresponding iterator element.
Returns:
an object array of the iterator's elements following the order defined by the iterator indices.

toMap

public static <E,K> java.util.Map<? super K,java.util.Collection<E>> toMap(java.util.Iterator<? extends E> iterator,
                                                                           Function<? super E,? extends K> getKey,
                                                                           java.util.Map<? super K,java.util.Collection<E>> map,
                                                                           Function<?,? extends java.util.Collection<E>> newCollection)
Converts an iterator to a map. Partitions the iterator's elements according to the result of the unary function getKey. Each partition is the value of its corresponding map entry and is implemented as a collection.

Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements returned by the given iterator.
K - the type of the keys used for mapping the elements of the given iterator.
Parameters:
iterator - the input iterator.
getKey - unary function that determines the key for an iterator's element.
map - the map used to store the partitions.
newCollection - creates a new collection to store the elements of a new partition.
Returns:
the map implementing the partition of the iterator's elements.

toMap

public static <E,K> java.util.Map<? super K,java.util.Collection<E>> toMap(java.util.Iterator<? extends E> iterator,
                                                                           Function<? super E,? extends K> getKey,
                                                                           java.util.Map<? super K,java.util.Collection<E>> map)
Converts an iterator to a map. Partitions the iterator's elements according to the result of the unary function getKey. Each partition is the value of its corresponding map entry and is implemented as a linked list.

Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements returned by the given iterator.
K - the type of the keys used for mapping the elements of the given iterator.
Parameters:
iterator - the input iterator.
getKey - unary function that determines the key for an iterator's element.
map - the map used to store the partitions.
Returns:
the map implementing the partition of the iterator's elements.

toMap

public static <E,K> java.util.Map<? super K,java.util.Collection<E>> toMap(java.util.Iterator<? extends E> iterator,
                                                                           Function<? super E,? extends K> getKey,
                                                                           Function<?,? extends java.util.Collection<E>> newCollection)
Converts an iterator to a hash map. Partitions the iterator's elements according to the result of the unary function getKey. Each partition is the value part of its corresponding map entry and is implemented as a collection.

Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements returned by the given iterator.
K - the type of the keys used for mapping the elements of the given iterator.
Parameters:
iterator - the input iterator.
getKey - unary function that determines the key for an iterator's element.
newCollection - creates a new collection to store the elements of a new partition.
Returns:
the map implementing the partition of the iterator's elements.

toMap

public static <E,K> java.util.Map<? super K,java.util.Collection<E>> toMap(java.util.Iterator<? extends E> iterator,
                                                                           Function<? super E,? extends K> getKey)
Converts an iterator to a hash map. Partitions the iterator's elements according to the result of the function getKey. Each partition is the value part of its corresponding map entry and is implemented as a linked list.

Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements returned by the given iterator.
K - the type of the keys used for mapping the elements of the given iterator.
Parameters:
iterator - the input iterator.
getKey - unary function that determines the key for an iterator's element.
Returns:
the map implementing the partition of the iterator's elements.

wrap

public static <E> Cursor<E> wrap(java.util.Iterator<E> iterator)
Wraps the given iterator to a cursor. If the given iterator is already a cursor, it is returned unchanged. The current implementation is as follows: 
   return iterator instanceof Cursor ?
       (Cursor<E>)iterator :
       new IteratorCursor<E>(iterator);

Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements returned by the given iterator.
Parameters:
iterator - the iterator to be wrapped.
Returns:
a cursor wrapping the given iterator.
See Also:
IteratorCursor

wrapToMetaDataCursor

public static <E,M> MetaDataCursor<E,M> wrapToMetaDataCursor(java.util.Iterator<E> iterator,
                                                             M metaData)
Wraps a given iterator (keep in mind that a cursor is also an iterator) to a meta data cursor. In that way an ordinary iterator can be enriched by meta data that is provided via the getMetaData method.

Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements returned by the given iterator.
M - the type of the given meta data object.
Parameters:
iterator - the iterator to be enriched by meta data information.
metaData - an object containing the meta data information.
Returns:
a meta data cursor enriching the given iterator by some meta data information.
